author: chfast
content:
Hi, I'm playing with EVMMAX implementation. And I'm also noob in cryptography implementations.

I have implemented bn254 point addition (precompile 6). I used basic exponentiation for compute a field element inversion. Now looking for improvements because it takes ~90% of total time.  I've checked libff uses extended GCD algorithm. There is also option to generate "addchain" with ~300 multiplications. Any recommendations what to choose?

cc <@427903869226582018>

author: kevaundray
content:
The easiest thing to implement imo is addition chain, then you can see if its performant enough.

Here is a tool to generate addition chains: <https://github.com/mmcloughlin/addchain>

gnark uses binary gcd which should be pretty performant, but its not as easy to implement as add-chains <https://github.com/ConsenSys/gnark-crypto/blob/8f7ca09273c24ed9465043566906cbecf5dcee91/ecc/bn254/fp/element.go#L1197>

author: chfast
content: Thanks. We will try to implement the binary GCD from the linked paper.
